(Simplified: 鸳)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 夗 indicates the sound; 鳥 (bird) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 夗 [ yuàn ] to turn over when asleep
    • 鳥 [ niǎo ] bird
①(鴛鴦)水鳥，比鴨小，棲息於池沼之上，雌雄常在一起。民間傳說和文學上用來喻夫妻；又用來稱成偶的東西，如“鴛鴛劍”。簡稱“鴛”，如“鴛侶”(喻夫妻)。
鴛鴦 [ yuān yāng ]: (bird species of China) mandarin duck (Aix galericulata); (fig.) affectionate couple; happily married couple
鴛鴦戲水 [ yuān yāng xì shuǐ ]: lit. mandarin ducks playing in the water; fig. to make love
鴛鴦蝴蝶派 [ yuān yang hú dié pài ]: Mandarin ducks and butterfly (i.e. love birds) literary school around 1900, criticized as populist and romantic by socialist realists
鴛夢重溫 [ yuān mèng chóng wēn ]: to rekindle an old flame of love; reunion of old lovers after a long separation (idiom)
鴛綺 [ yuān qǐ ]: magnificent fabrics
(Simplified: 鸳)

Pictophonetic: 夗 indicates the sound; 鳥 (bird) conveys the meaning.

English senses 英语理解: male mandarin duck (Aix galericulata)

yuān

鴛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yuān］
［《廣韻》於袁切，平元，影。］
［《廣韻》烏渾切，平魂，影。］
“鸳1”的繁体字。
(1)鸳鸯的省称。
(2)同“鵷”。参见“鴛鷺行”、“鴛鸞”。

鴛字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鴛； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1485第28
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?於袁切，音眢。【說文】鴛鴦也。【玉篇】匹鳥。雄曰鴛，雌曰鴦。【崔豹·古今註】鳧類，雌雄未嘗相離，人得其一，則一必思而死，故謂匹鳥。【埤雅】鵲好外反，鴛好內思。【詩·小雅】鴛鴦在梁，戢其左翼。【正字通】鴛鴦紅頭，翅尾黑，頭有白長毛，質杏黃色具文采。又【廣韻】烏渾切【集韻】烏昆切，?音溫。義同。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yuān］
["Guangyun" in Yuanqie, Pingyuan, Shadow. ]
["Guangyun" Wuhunqi, Ping Hun, Shadow. ]
Traditional characters for "鸳1".
(1) The provincial name of Mandarin Duck.
(2) The same as "Guan". See "Mandarin and Heron", "Mandarin Luan".
mandarin duck
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Bird Character Department] 　鸳; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1485 28
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Yu Yuanqie, sound 眢. [Said the text] Mandarin ducks also. 【Jade articles】Birds. The male is called a mandarin, and the female is called a duck. [Cui Bao · Ancient and Modern Notes] Mallards, males and females are not separated, if a person gets one, he must think and die, so it is called a bird. [Bai Ya] Magpies are good for external reflexes, while Mandarins are good for internal thinking. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】The mandarin duck is in the Liang, and it is on the left wing. 【Zhengzitong】Mandarin ducks have a red head, black tails, white hairs on their heads, apricot-yellow quality and literary grace. Also [Guangyun] Wuhunqi [Jiyun] Wukunqi, sound temperature. The same meaning.
